description: From Middle English bestriden, from Old English bestrīdan; equivalent to be- +‎ stride. Compare Dutch bestrijden, German bestreiten.

verbs.description: bestride (third-person singular simple present bestrides, present participle bestriding, simple past bestrode, past participle bestrode or bestridden or bestrid) # (transitive) To stride over, or across.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To be astride something, to stand over or sit on with legs on either side, especially to sit on a horse.
